subject: Cooking
title: Why Resting Meat Matters
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Resting Meat Matters.

hook.text: Slice a steak straight off the grill and juices flood your cutting board. That's lost flavor.

buildup.text: During cooking, heat forces moisture toward the center as outer proteins contract and squeeze.

discovery.text: Resting lets proteins relax and reabsorb juice. A 5-minute rest can retain 10% more moisture.

twist.text: But rest too long and the meat cools below ideal serving temperature. Timing matters.

climax.text: Professional kitchens rest large roasts for 15â€“20 minutes, tented loosely with foil.

punchline.text: The last step of cooking is not cooking at all.
